page.title: 19ARCHITECTURE
page.content: The area of Dartington is fortunate to have a number of buildings of historical and architectural interest. They range from the Norman buildings of Dartington Hall, Totnes Castle,and the Cott Inn to International Style and Neo-Classical buildings forming part of the Dartington Estate, constructed under the patronage of Leonard and Dorothy Elmhirst.These include the Central Offices of the Dartington Hall Trust,the Headmaster's house of Dartington School,a number of Estate workers houses and a small development of rented houses at Broom Park. Architects involved included William Lescaze and Lois De Soissons. The area also has a number of radical new developments,including Hunters Moon and Riverside housing estates,and Webbers Yard industrial estate.
